intro: Viola obtusa var. nuda, commonly known as the naked viola, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of East Asia. It features heart-shaped, hairy leaves that are typically arranged alternately along its stems. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers with five petals, often with a distinctive dark purple or blackish spot at the base. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species within the Violaceae family.
